intro: Actinomeris alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf actinomeris, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
